00004 /*
00005  * saveimage.c --
00006  *
00007  * Function to save an executable copy of the current process's
00008  * image in a file.
00009  *
00010  */
00011 
00012 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00013 #include <config.h>
00014 #include <stdio.h>
00015 #include <bdd/util.h>
00016 
00017 #ifdef BSD
00018 #include <sys/types.h>
00019 #include <sys/stat.h>
00020 #include <a.out.h>
00021 #include <errno.h>
00022 
00023 extern int errno;
00024 
00025 #define BUFSIZE         8192
00026 
00027 extern long lseek();    /* For lint */
00028 extern int getpagesize();
00029 extern char *sbrk();
00030 
00031 static int copy_file();
00032 static int pad_file();
00033 
00034 
00035 int util_save_image(char *orig_file_name, char *save_file_name)
00036 {
00037     int origFd = -1, saveFd = -1;
00038     char *start_data, *end_data, *start_text, *end_round;
00039     struct exec old_hdr, new_hdr;
00040     struct stat old_stat;
00041     int n, page_size, length_text, length_data;
00042 
00043     if ((origFd = open(orig_file_name, 0)) < 0) {
00044         perror(orig_file_name);
00045         (void) fprintf(stderr, "Cannot open original a.out file\n");
00046         goto bad;
00047     }
00048 
00049     if (fstat(origFd, &old_stat) < 0) {
00050         perror(orig_file_name);
00051         (void) fprintf(stderr, "Cannot stat original a.out file\n");
00052         goto bad;
00053     }
00054 
00055     /*
00056      * Read the a.out header from the original file.
00057      */
00058     if (read(origFd, (char *) &old_hdr, sizeof(old_hdr)) != sizeof(old_hdr)) {
00059         perror(orig_file_name);
00060         (void) fprintf(stderr, "Cannot read original a.out header\n");
00061         goto bad;
00062     }
00063     if (N_BADMAG(old_hdr)) {
00064         (void) fprintf(stderr, "File %s has a bad magic number (%o)\n",
00065                         orig_file_name, old_hdr.a_magic);
00066         goto bad;
00067     }
00068     if (old_hdr.a_magic != ZMAGIC) {
00069         (void) fprintf(stderr, "File %s is not demand-paged\n", orig_file_name);
00070         goto bad;
00071     }
00072 
00073     /*
00074      * Open the output file.
00075      */
00076     if (access(save_file_name, /* F_OK */ 0) == 0) {
00077         (void) unlink(save_file_name);
00078     }
00079     if ((saveFd = creat(save_file_name, 0777)) < 0) {
00080         if (errno == ETXTBSY) {
00081             (void) unlink(save_file_name);
00082             saveFd = creat(save_file_name, 0777);
00083         }
00084         if (saveFd < 0) {
00085             perror(save_file_name);
00086             (void) fprintf(stderr, "Cannot create save file.\n");
00087             goto bad;
00088         }
00089     }
00090 
00091     /*
00092      * Find out how far the data segment extends.
00093      */
00094     new_hdr = old_hdr;
00095     end_data = sbrk(0);
00096     page_size = getpagesize();
00097     n = ((((int) end_data) + page_size - 1) / page_size) * page_size;
00098     end_round = (char *) n;
00099     if (end_round > end_data) {
00100         end_data = sbrk(end_round - end_data);
00101     }
00102 
00103 #ifdef vax
00104     start_text = 0;
00105     length_text = new_hdr.a_text;
00106     start_data = (char *) old_hdr.a_text;
00107     length_data = end_data - start_data;
00108 #endif vax
00109 #ifdef  sun
00110     start_text = (char *) N_TXTADDR(old_hdr) + sizeof(old_hdr);
00111     length_text = old_hdr.a_text - sizeof(old_hdr);
00112     start_data = (char *) N_DATADDR(old_hdr);
00113     length_data = end_data - start_data;
00114 #endif  sun
00115     new_hdr.a_data = end_data - start_data;
00116     new_hdr.a_bss = 0;
00117 
00118     /*
00119      * First, the header plus enough pad to extend up to N_TXTOFF.
00120      */
00121     if (write(saveFd, (char *) &new_hdr, (int) sizeof(new_hdr)) !=
00122                                 sizeof(new_hdr)) {
00123         perror("write");
00124         (void) fprintf(stderr, "Error while copying header.\n");
00125         goto bad;
00126     }
00127     if (! pad_file(saveFd, N_TXTOFF(old_hdr) - sizeof(new_hdr))) {
00128         (void) fprintf(stderr, "Error while padding.\n");
00129         goto bad;
00130     }
00131 
00132 
00133     /*
00134      *  Copy our text segment
00135      */
00136     if (write(saveFd, start_text, length_text) != length_text) {
00137         perror("write");
00138         (void) fprintf(stderr, "Error while copying text segment.\n");
00139         goto bad;
00140     }
00141 
00142 
00143     /*
00144      *  Copy our data segment
00145      */
00146     if (write(saveFd, start_data, length_data) != length_data) {
00147         perror("write");
00148         (void) fprintf(stderr, "Error while copying data segment.\n");
00149         goto bad;
00150     }
00151 
00152     /*
00153      * Copy the symbol table and everything else.
00154      * This takes us to the end of the original file.
00155      */
00156     (void) lseek(origFd, (long) N_SYMOFF(old_hdr), 0);
00157     if (! copy_file(origFd, saveFd, old_stat.st_size - N_SYMOFF(old_hdr))) {
00158         (void) fprintf(stderr, "Error while copying symbol table.\n");
00159         goto bad;
00160     }
00161     (void) close(origFd);
00162     (void) close(saveFd);
00163     return 1;
00164 
00165 bad:
00166     if (origFd >= 0) (void) close(origFd);
00167     if (saveFd >= 0) (void) close(saveFd);
00168     return 0;
00169 }
00170 
00171 
00172 static int copy_file(int inFd, int outFd, unsigned long nbytes)
00173 {
00174     char buf[BUFSIZE];
00175     int nread, ntoread;
00176 
00177     while (nbytes > 0) {
00178         ntoread = nbytes;
00179         if (ntoread > sizeof buf) ntoread = sizeof buf;
00180         if ((nread = read(inFd, buf, ntoread)) != ntoread) {
00181             perror("read");
00182             return (0);
00183         }
00184         if (write(outFd, buf, nread) != nread) {
00185             perror("write");
00186             return (0);
00187         }
00188         nbytes -= nread;
00189     }
00190 
00191     return (1);
00192 }
00193 
00194 
00195 static int pad_file(int outFd, int nbytes)
00196 {
00197     char buf[BUFSIZE];
00198     int nzero;
00199 
00200     nzero = (nbytes > sizeof(buf)) ? sizeof(buf) : nbytes;
00201     bzero(buf, nzero);
00202     while (nbytes > 0) {
00203         nzero = (nbytes > sizeof(buf)) ? sizeof(buf) : nbytes;
00204         if (write(outFd, buf, nzero) != nzero) {
00205             perror("write");
00206             return (0);
00207         }
00208         nbytes -= nzero;
00209     }
00210 
00211     return (1);
00212 }
00213 #else
00214 
00215 /* ARGSUSED */
00216 int util_save_image(char *orig_file_name, char *save_file_name)
00217 {
00218     (void) fprintf(stderr, 
00219         "util_save_image: not implemented on your operating system\n");
00220     return 0;
00221 }

00223 #endif
